statement.p: The lift equation is \displaystyle{L}={\frac{{{1}}}{{{2}}}}\rho{S}{C}_{{L}}{v}^{{2}} where \displaystyle\rho is the density of air, \displaystyle{S} is the surface area of the airfoil (wing), \displaystyle{C}_{{L}} is called the coefficient of lift, and \displaystyle{L} is the lift (measured in pounds).
Calculate the velocity necessary to produce \displaystyle{L}={3300} lbs of lift if \displaystyle\rho={0.001988}, \displaystyle{S}={174}, and \displaystyle{C}_{{L}}={4.2}.
Round according to the rules for measurements.
